basic.description: This course examines attitudes towards sexuality in ancient Greek and Roman culture, and the influence of Greek and Roman norms on later cultures and periods, including and especially our own; sexual identities play a large and increasing role in modern political life. Students explore a wide variety of literary, non-literary, and visual material in order to understand the dynamics of sexuality and power as they operate in the ancient and modern world.
basic.subject: IFS
basic.title: Ancient Sexualities and Modern Sexual Politics
